info.title: EBSCO HoldingsIQ
info.description: The EBSCO HoldingsIQ service retrieves vendor, package and title related information in JSON format.  The information includes customer selected resources as reflected in the EBSCO Knowledge Base for both EBSCO managed and customer managed resources.

get.description:
This operation allows you to retrieve the list of all custom field labels and the root proxy.

  **Please Note:**  The last forward slash in the url for this resource is only needed when using the sandbox.  Do not use the last forward slash in the url for the live api.  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

200.description: List of all custom labels and the root proxy.  Up to 5 labels can be retrieved in the response.

403.description: User is not authorized to access this resource.

put.description:
This operation allows you to create and label up to five custom fields for your Title Details. Specify the field label ID, Display Label Name and indicate whether youâ€™d like the information to display on Publication Finder and/or Full Text Finder. Once the Custom Label field(s) have been created, one can verify it in  Title Details REST end point. Not specifying the Custom labels details  for a given custom label ID in the payload will result in setting displayLabel to empty string.  If you do not provide a JSON payload, the JSON payload will be set to the default values and customizations made previously will be lost.  If you wish to keep your current customizations, please be sure to set the JSON payload accordingly.  

  **Please Note:** The last forward slash in the url for this resource is only needed when using the sandbox.  Do not use the last forward slash in the url for the live api.  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

requestBody.description: JSON payload to update custom labels and proxy.

204.description: The server has successfully fulfilled the PUT request.

get.description:
This operation allows you to retrieve the list of all available customer proxies.

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

get.description:
This operation allows you to search EPKB by vendor.  It returns a list of vendors that includes customer context and the total number of results.  When searching for vendors without a search parameter, sort options will be by vendor name.  When the search parameter is not null, the default sort is by relevance.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search Term - When searching for vendors without a search parameter, sort options will be by vendorname.  When the search parameter is not null, the default sort is by relevance.  Special characters in the search term need to be URL encoded.  Ex: A&G encodes to A%26G.  The Swagger Explorer performs the search parameter encoding for the **Try it out!**.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Valid values are relevance and vendorname.  Default is relevance.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Page Offset.  Starts at 1.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

200.description: List of vendors matching the vendor name and the total number vendors found.

get.description:
This operation allows you to retrieve vendor details from EPKB for a specific vendor ID.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: vendorid
parameters.description: Vendor ID

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

200.description: Vendor details from EPKB for a specific vendor ID.

put.summary: Update Vendor Proxy and Token Values
put.description:
This operation allows you to update vendor proxy and token values for a specific vendor ID.  If a vendor does not have a token set up, the JSON payload should have an empty token with a proxy value.  A vendor with **inherited** set to true inherits its proxy from the root proxy.  So, a JSON payload with **inherited** set to true updates the vendor proxy with the root proxy if the root proxy is set.  If you do not provide a JSON payload, the JSON payload will be set to the default values and customizations made previously will be lost.  If you wish to keep your current customizations, please be sure to set the JSON payload accordingly.  

  **Please Note:** Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: vendorid
parameters.description: Vendor ID

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

requestBody.description: JSON payload to update a vendor.

bodyoptiona.summary: JSON payload to update a vendor with a proxy

bodyoptionb.summary: JSON payload to update a vendor with an inherited proxy

bodyoptionc.summary: JSON payload to update a vendor with a non-inherited proxy

204.description: The server has successfully fulfilled the PUT request.

get.summary: Get List of Packages for a Vendor
get.description:
This operation allows you to retrieve a list of packages from EPKB for a vendor including customer context.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: vendorid
parameters.description: Vendor ID

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keyword search applied to limit the package list results.  The search term is contained in the package name.  When searching for packages without a search parameter, the sort options will be by packagename.  When the search parameter is not null, then the default sort is by relevance.  Special characters in the search term need to be URL encoded.  Ex: A&G encodes to A%26G.  The Swagger Explorer performs the search parameter encoding for the **Try it out!**.

parameters.name: searchtype
parameters.description: Type of search to be performed.  Valid values are exactphrase and advanced.  It is also valid to use 1 for exactphrase or 2 for advanced.

parameters.name: selection
parameters.description: Limits the result set.  Valid values are all, selected, notselected and orderedthroughebsco.  It is also valid to use 0 for all, 1 for selected, 2 for notselected, or 3 for ordered through EBSCO.  When you filter by all(0), the total results count takes selected and not selected into consideration.

parameters.name: contenttype
parameters.description: Limit by type of package content.  Both integer and string are supported.  Valid values are all, aggregatedfulltext, abstractandindex, ebook, ejournal, print, unknown and onlinereference.  It is also valid to use 0 for all, 1 for aggregated full text, 2 for abstract and index, 3 for ebook, 4 for ejournal, 5 for print, 6 for unknown or 7 for online reference.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Valid values are relevance or packagename.  Default is relevance.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Page Offset.  Starts at 1.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API.  Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

200.description: List of packages from EPKB for a specific vendor ID and the total number of results.

post.description:
This operation allows you to create custom packages.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: vendorid
parameters.description: Vendor ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

requestBody.description: JSON POST payload.  Specify the packageName in the payload.  Set contentType in the payload to 1 for Agregated Full Text, 2 for Abstract and Index, 3 for Ebook, 4 for E-Journal, 5 for Print, 6 for Unknown or 7 for Online Reference.  Set the custom coverage dates.  Set the proxy ID.

get.description:
This operation allows you to search for packages and returns a list of packages from EPKB.  The list is not limited to a single vendor ID.  The response will reflect the context of the EBSCO customer ID included in the request.  When searching for packages without a search parameter, the sort options will be by package name.  When the search parameter is not null, then the default sort is by relevance.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keyword search that is applied to limit the results to packages from the vendor that have the search term in the package name.  Special characters in the search term need to be URL encoded.  Ex: A&G encodes to A%26G.  The Swagger Explorer performs the search parameter encoding for the **Try it out!**.

parameters.name: searchtype
parameters.description: Type of search to be performed.  Valid values are exactphrase and advanced.  It is also valid to use 1 for exactphrase or 2 for advanced.

parameters.name: selection
parameters.description: Limits the results.  Valid values are all, selected, notselected, and orderedthroughebsco.  It is also valid to use 0 for all, 1 for selected, 2 for not selected or 3 for ordered through EBSCO.  When you filter by all(0), the total results count takes selected and not selected into consideration.

parameters.name: contenttype
parameters.description: Limits the results by type of package content.  Both integer and string are supported.  Valid values are all, aggregatedfulltext, abstractandindex, ebook, ejournal, print, unknown and onlinereference.  It is also valid to use 0 for all, 1 for aggregated full text, 2 for abstract and index, 3 for ebook, 4 for ejournal, 5 for print, 6 for unknown or 7 for online reference.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Valid values are packagename and relevance. Default is relevance.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Page Offset.  Starts at 1.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

200.description: List of packages and the total packages found.

get.description:
This operation allows you to retrieve EPKB information for a specific package.  It returns details in the context of a customer.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: vendorid
parameters.description: Vendor ID

parameters.name: packageid
parameters.description: Package ID

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

200.description: Package details from EPKB for a specific package ID.

put.description:
This operation allows you to update selection and customizations to a package in a customer EPKB account.  A package with inherited set to true inherits its proxy from the root proxy. So, a JSON payload with inherited set to true updates the package proxy with the root proxy if the root proxy is set.  The isSelected payload element is mandatory for managed and custom packages. isSelected, packageName and contentType payload elements are mandatory for the custom package update payload. For both managed and custom packages, removing a package with isSelected set to false in the payload will result in a loss of customization made previously at the package level. Removing a custom package with isSelected set to false in the payload will result in the deletion (hard delete) of the custom package and all associated titles from this custom package.  If the payload contains ONLY isSelected set to true with no other customization fields, the system will remove all previously set customization.  If you do not provide a JSON payload, the JSON payload will be set to the default values and customizations made previously will be lost.  If you wish to keep your current customizations, please be sure to set the JSON payload accordingly.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: vendorid
parameters.description: Vendor ID

parameters.name: packageid
parameters.description: Package ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

requestBody.description: JSON payload to update selection and customizations to a package.

bodyoptiona.summary: JSON payload to select the entire package

bodyoptionb.summary: JSON payload to set custom coverage including hiding titles

bodyoptionc.summary: JSON payload to hide a package

bodyoptiond.summary: JSON payload to set custom coverage excluding hiding titles

bodyoptione.summary: JSON payload to unselect the entire package

bodyoptionf.summary: JSON payload to set custom coverage to a partially selected package

bodyoptiong.summary: JSON payload to set values in a managed package
bodyoptiong.description: JSON payload to set values in a managed package.  isSelected is required for a managed package.

bodyoptionh.summary: JSON payload to set values in a custom package
bodyoptionh.description: JSON payload to set values in a custom package. isSelected, contentType, and packageName are required for a custom package.

bodyoptioni.summary: JSON payload to update a package with a proxy

bodyoptionj.summary: JSON payload to update a package with an inherited proxy

204.description: The server has successfully fulfilled the PUT request.

get.summary: Get Titles that are Part of a Package
get.description:
This operation allows you to search and retrieve a list of titles from EPKB that are part of a specified package.  The response will reflect the context of the EBSCO customer ID included in the request.  When searching for titles without a search parameter, the sort options will be by title name.  When the search parameter is not null, the default sort is by relevance.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: vendorid
parameters.description: Vendor ID

parameters.name: packageid
parameters.description: Package ID

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keyword search that is applied to limit the results to titles from the package that have the search term in the search field.  When searching for titles without a search parameter, the sort options will be by titlename. When the search parameter is not null, then the default sort is by relevance.  Special characters in the search term need to be URL encoded.  Ex: A&G encodes to A%26G.  The Swagger Explorer performs the search parameter encoding for the **Try it out!**.

parameters.name: searchfield
parameters.description: Field to search.  Both integer and string are supported.  Valid values are titlename, publisher, isxn, and subject.  It is also valid to use 0 for title name, 1 for publisher, 2 for isxn or 3 for subject.

parameters.name: selection
parameters.description: Limits the results.  Valid values are all, selected, notselected and orderedthroughebsco.  It is also valid to use 0 for all, 1 for selected, 2 for notselected, or 3 for ordered through EBSCO.  When you filter by all(0), the total results count takes selected and not selected into consideration.

parameters.name: resourcetype
parameters.description: Type of resource. Valid values are all, journal, newsletter, report, proceedings, website, newspaper, unspecified, book, bookseries, database, thesisdissertation, streamingaudio, streamingvideo, and audiobook.  It is also valid to use 0 for all, 1 for journal, 2 for newsletter, 3 for report, 4 for proceedings, 5 for website, 6 for newspaper, 7 for unspecified, 8 for book, 9 for book series, 10 for database, 11 for thesis dissertation, 12 for streaming audio, 13 for streaming video, or 14 for audio book.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Valid values are relevance and titlename.  Default is relevance.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Page Offset.  Starts at 1.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

200.description: Titles from EPKB for a specific package ID.

post.description:
This operation allows you to create custom titles.  The titleName and pubType elements are required in the custom title payload.  If your JSON POST payload contains multiple coverage dates, the dates must be in descending order.   

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: vendorid
parameters.description: Vendor ID

parameters.name: packageid
parameters.description: Package ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

requestBody.description: JSON POST title details payload.  The titleName and pubType elements are required in the custom title payload.  If your JSON POST payload contains multiple coverage dates, the dates must be in descending order.

get.description:
This operation allows you to retrieve details for a particular package-title from EPKB.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: vendorid
parameters.description: Vendor ID

parameters.name: packageid
parameters.description: Package ID

parameters.name: kbid
parameters.description: Title ID

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

200.description:
Title Response 

 Package-title from EPKB regardless of the package that it is a part of.

put.summary: Update a Title in a Package
put.description:
This operation allows you to update selection status, proxy value or coverage customizations for a title within a package in a customer EPKB account.  A title with **inherited** set to true inherits its proxy from the root proxy.  So, a JSON payload with **inherited** set to true updates the title proxy with the root proxy if the root proxy is set.  The isSelected payload element is mandatory for managed and custom titles.  The titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title update payload.  For both managed and custom titles, removing a title with isSelected set to false in the payload will result in a loss of customization made previously at the title level.  Removing a custom title with isSelected set to false in the payload will result in the deletion (hard delete) of the custom title from the custom package.  If the payload contains ONLY isSelected set to true with no other customization fields, the system will remove all previously set customization.  If you do not provide a JSON payload, the JSON payload will be set to the default values and customizations made previously will be lost.  If you wish to keep your current customizations, please be sure to set the JSON payload accordingly.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: vendorid
parameters.description: Vendor ID

parameters.name: packageid
parameters.description: Package ID

parameters.name: kbid
parameters.description: Title ID

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

requestBody.description: JSON payload to update a title within a package.  The isSelected, titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload.

bodyoptiona.summary: JSON payload to select a package-title
bodyoptiona.description: JSON payload to select a package-title. The isSelected payload element is mandatory for managed and custom titles.  The titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload.

bodyoptionb.summary: JSON payload to hide a package-title
bodyoptionb.description: JSON payload to hide a package-title. The isSelected payload element is mandatory for managed and custom titles. The titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload.

bodyoptionc.summary: JSON payload to set custom coverage, coverage statement and custom embargo
bodyoptionc.description: JSON payload to set custom coverage, coverage statement and custom embargo. The isSelected payload element is mandatory for managed and custom titles. The titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload. When adding multiple custom coverage date ranges, the most recent date range must be first followed by date ranges in descending order. If another custom coverage date range is added that is greater than the previously entered date range, the system will show the error message - CoverageList contains a date that exceeds a previous date value.

bodyoptiond.summary: JSON payload to un-select a package-title
bodyoptiond.description: JSON payload to un-select a package-title. The isSelected payload element is mandatory for managed and custom titles. The titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload.

bodyoptione.summary: JSON payload to un-hide a package-title
bodyoptione.description: JSON payload to un-hide a package-title. The isSelected payload element is mandatory for managed and custom titles. The titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload.

bodyoptionf.summary: JSON payload to set user defined fields
bodyoptionf.description: JSON payload to set user defined fields. The isSelected payload element is mandatory for managed and custom titles. The titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload.

bodyoptiong.description: JSON combined payload. The isSelected payload element is mandatory for managed and custom titles. The titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload. When adding multiple custom coverage date ranges, the most recent date range must be first followed by date ranges in descending order. If another custom coverage date range is added that is greater than the previously entered date range, the system will show the error message - CoverageList contains a date that exceeds a previous date value.

bodyoptionh.summary: JSON payload to update the details of a custom title
bodyoptionh.description: JSON payload to update the details of a custom title. The isSelected, titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload.

bodyoptioni.summary: JSON payload to update the proxy value for a custom title
bodyoptioni.description: JSON payload to update the proxy value for a custom title. The isSelected, titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload.

bodyoptionj.summary: JSON payload to update the proxy value for a custom title {option 2}
bodyoptionj.description: JSON payload to update the proxy value for a custom title. The isSelected, titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload.

bodyoptionk.summary: JSON payload to update the inherited proxy value for a custom title
bodyoptionk.description: JSON payload to update the inherited proxy value for a custom title. The isSelected, titleName and pubType payload elements are mandatory for the custom title payload.

204.description: The server has successfully fulfilled the PUT request.

get.summary: Get List of Titles Regardless of Package
get.description:
This operation allows you to search and retrieve a list of titles from EPKB regardless of the package(s) that the titles are a part of.  The response will reflect the context of the EBSCO customer ID included in the request.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search Term.  Keyword search that is applied to limit the results to titles that have the search term in the search field.  Special characters in the search term need to be URL encoded.  Ex: A&G encodes to A%26G.  The Swagger Explorer performs the search parameter encoding for the **Try it out!**.

parameters.name: searchfield
parameters.description: Field to search.  Both integer and string are supported.  Valid values are titlename, publisher, isxn, subject and zdbid.  It is also valid to use 0 for title name, 1 for publisher, 2 for isxn, 3 for subject or 4 for zdbid.

parameters.name: selection
parameters.description: Limits the results.  Valid values are all, selected, notselected and orderedthroughebsco.  It is also valid to use 0 for all, 1 for selected, 2 for notselected, or 3 for ordered through EBSCO.  When you filter by all(0), the total results count takes selected and not selected into consideration.

parameters.name: resourcetype
parameters.description: Type of resource. Valid values are all, journal, newsletter, report, proceedings, website, newspaper, unspecified, book, bookseries, database, thesisdissertation, streamingaudio, streamingvideo, and audiobook.  It is also valid to use 0 for all, 1 for journal, 2 for newsletter, 3 for report, 4 for proceedings, 5 for website, 6 for newspaper, 7 for unspecified, 8 for book, 9 for book series, 10 for database, 11 for thesis dissertation, 12 for streaming audio, 13 for streaming video, or 14 for audio book.

parameters.name: searchtype
parameters.description: Type of search. Search types are any, contains, exactmatch, beginswith, proximity, exactphrase and advanced. It is also valid to use 0 for any, 1 for contains, 2 for exactmatch, 3 for beginswith, 4 for proximity, 5 for exactphrase or 6 for advanced.  searchtype is an optional parameter and defaults to contains if not provided.  For more information on the search types, see [Using Search Types](https://developer.ebsco.com/guides/overviewsearch/)

parameters.name: packageidfilter
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of package ID(s).  Limits the results by package ID(s).  The packageidfilter is an optional parameter.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Valid values are relevance or titlename.  Default is relevance.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Page Offset.  Starts at 1.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

200.description: List of titles that are part of a specified package.

get.summary: Get Title Details Regardless of Package
get.description:
This operation allows you to retrieve details for a particular title from EPKB regardless of the package that it is a part of.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: kbid
parameters.description: Title ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

200.description:
Title Response 

 Details for the title.

get.description:
This operation allows you to download customer holdings in KBART2 (JSON) format.  Before using this resource, you need to perform a Holdings Resource POST to populate holdings data to a staging area.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Download format.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response. Count can not exceed 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Page Offset.  Starts at 1.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

post.description:
This operation populates holdings data to a staging area.  You must perform this operation before using the GET holdings resources.  Customer holdings will be refreshed each time a POST is complete.  Hidden titles and packages are excluded from the holdings download.  If the customer has made changes since the last POST, another POST needs to be performed before using a GET holdings resource in order to download all of the changes.  If any metadata has changed since the last POST, you do not need to perform another POST in order to see the metadata changes in the GET holdings.  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: force is used to force a new request.  force is an optional parameter and defaults to false if not provided.  Set force to true to recreate the holdings snapshot by overwriting the existing snapshot.  force parameter should not be used on a regular basis.  force is only to be used for resolving a stuck POST holdings request.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API.  Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

202.description: The request to populate holdings has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.

get.description:
This operation allows you to retrieve the status of a holdings snapshot.  The response reveals if the holdings snapshot is in progress, completed, not staged (none) or has failed.  The status enables you to decide when to download customer holdings (upon completion).  

  **Please Note:**  Your production API key to access HoldingsIQ will not give you access to our sandbox. Therefore, your production API key will not give you access to the API through our interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to gain access to the API through our interactive documentation or to use the sandbox directly. If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: custid
parameters.description: EBSCO Customer ID

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Unique code assigned by EBSCO to grant you access to this API.  The API key needs to be a header parameter for every operation in order to access this API. Your production API key will not grant you access to the API through the interactive documentation. You will need a sandbox API key to use the interactive documentation.  If you require a sandbox API key, please contact EBSCO customer support.

subtype.description: Subtype for the identifier.  Valid values are 1 for Print and 2 for Online.

type.description: Type of identifier.  Valid values are 0 for ISSN and 1 for ISBN.
Type of contributor. Valid values are Author, Illustrator, and Editor.

pubType.description: Type of publication. Valid values are journal, newsletter, report, proceedings, website, newspaper, unspecified, book, bookseries, database, thesisdissertation, streamingaudio, streamingvideo, and audiobook.

pubType.description: Type of publication. Valid values are journal, newsletter, report, proceedings, website, newspaper, unspecified, book, bookseries, database, thesisdissertation, streamingaudio, streamingvideo, and audiobook.

isPeerReviewed.description: Field to indicate if title is peer reviewed.

isHidden.description: Field to indicate if title is hidden.

status.description: Status. Valid values are In Progress, Completed, None or Failed.

totalCount.description: Total Count.  Note: Only available for Completed.

publication_title.description: Title of the serial or monograph being represented.  Conference proceedings serial title should be entered as a serial title, while conference proceeding volume titles should be entered as a monograph title.

print_identifier.description: ISSN or ISBN of the print version of the work.  Note: If the item is a book and has both an ISBN and ISSN, use ISBN.

online_identifier.description: ISSN or ISBN of the online version of work. Note:  If item is a book and has both an ISBN and ISSN, use the ISBN.

date_first_issue_online.description: The publication date of the earliest serial issue available online in the format of yyyy-mm-dd. Applicable only to serials.

num_first_vol_online.description: The volume number of the earliest serial issue available online. Applicable only to serials.

num_first_issue_online.description: The issue number of the earliest serial issue available online. Applicable only to serials.

date_last_issue_online.description: Date of the latest serial issue available online. Leave blank if coverage is to present. Applicable only to serials.

num_last_vol_online.description: The volume number of the latest serial issue available online. Leave blank if coverage is to present. Applicable only to serials.

num_last_issue_online.description: The issue number of the latest serial issue available online. Leave blank if coverage is to present. Applicable only to serials.

title_url.description: Title-level URL. Applicable to both monographs and serials. For conference proceeding, the title_url for the series and the title_url for each volume should be different.

first_author.description: First author of the monograph. Applicable only to monographs.

title_id.description: The unique identifier for the title. This is the report provider's proprietary identifier.

embargo_info.description: Embargo information as a coded string following rules in section 6.6.14 of the KBART recommended practice (i.e. 'P1Y' means an embargo is period of 1 year.)

coverage_depth.description: Coverage depth is defined in 6.6.15 of the KBART recommended practice. Multiple coverage depths can be specified with a semicolon to delimit values.

notes.description: Free text field to describe the specifics of the coverage policy.

publisher_name.description: Name of the publisher of the work. Not to be confused with the name of the hosting platform.

publication_type.description: Serial or Monograph. Use 'serial' for journals, book series and conference proceeding series. Use 'monograph' for books and individual conference proceeding volumes.

date_monograph_published_print.description: Date the monograph was first published in print. Applies to monographs only.

date_monograph_published_online.description: Date the monograph was first published online. Applies to monographs only.

monograph_volume.description: Number of the particular volume of the monograph. Applicable to ebooks and conference proceedings. For conference proceedings, use the volume within the conference proceedings series.

first_editor.description: First editor. Applicable to monographs only.

parent_publication_title_id.description: Title identifier of the parent publication. For a conference proceeding, this would be the title_id of the overall conference proceeding series.

preceding_publication_title_id.description: The title identifier of any preceding publication title for serials and conference proceeding serials.  The publisher's proprietary identifier should be used where it exists.

access_type.description: Indicates if the content in the journal is F-Free, P-Paid, H-Hybrid, PF-Paid then Free after embargo period.  The default is P-Paid.

package_name.description: Name of the package or full text database this title is part of. This should match the name of the same package as it appears in the KBARTManifest.

package_id.description: The provider's identifier for the package or full text database this title is part of. This should match the package_id of the same package as it appears in the KBARTManifest.

vendor_id.description: EBSCO KB's unique identifier for the provider.

inherited.description: Field to indicate if the proxy is inherited.
Field to indicate if the proxy is inherited.

updateVendorNonInheritedProxyPayload.description: JSON payload to update a vendor with an non-inherited proxy.

customLabels.description: List of all custom labels and root proxy.
